title: Making Sense of Tech Sector Earnings After a Big Week of Results

title: Here's Why Analysts Are Lowering Price Targets On Amazon After Q1 Earnings
text: E-commerce giant Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) reported mixed earnings Thursday and announced guidance that came in lower than analysts' estimates for the second quarter. Here's why analysts are lowering their price targets and sound more cautious moving forward.

text: The falling value of Amazon's investment in electric truck maker Rivian also fueled the loss.

title: Why Amazon Stock Crashed Today
text: The e-commerce giant lost a staggering $200 billion in market value.

title: Everything We Like And Dislike About Amazon's Q1 2022 Earnings
text: Amazon's market value plunged by more than 10% overnight after releasing weaker-than-expected first quarter results and a soft guidance for the current quarter. Investors were largely taken back by the company's report of its first consolidated net loss in years.

title: Amazon and Google just closed out their worst months on Wall Street since 2008
text: Amazon and Google wrapped up a rocky earnings season for Big Tech, reporting quarterly earnings results that fell short of Wall Street's expectations.

title: US stocks plummet to worst monthly performance since 2020
text: The US indexes fell sharply after opening lower, with the S&P 500 plummeting 3.6%. The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which fell nearly 1000 points last Friday, shed another 966 points as it sank more than 2.8% to 32,977.21.

title: Amazon Stock Suffers Its Biggest One-Day Drop Since 2006, Falling 14% After Report Of Quarterly Loss
text: Falling victim to the latest spasm of market volatility, Amazon shares plunged 14% today in the wake of a poor first-quarter earnings report. It was the company's worst single-day decline since 2006, according to Bloomberg data. The pullback, which saw the stock settle at $2,485.63 erased more than $200 billion in market value. title: Plowing Through Earnings Season with a Bullish Outlook
text: It's been a momentous earnings season, and everything from big tech to the price of gold has been relevant. Learn what you need to know here.

title: Amazon's Earnings Miss Isn't That Big of a Deal
text: A heavy post-market sell-off indicates many investors seem to be worried about Amazon.com Inc.'s ( AMZN , Financial) first-quarter earnings miss. However, it needs to be considered that the stock market is a forward-looking environment, so unless systemic headwinds persist, I believe the stock will likely recover.

title: $150 Billion Wiped Off Amazon's Market Value: Should You Buy Now?
text: Folks are shopping more in person, and sales growth is slowing for Amazon.

text: Amazon's (AMZN) first-quarter results reflect strength in AWS amid a slowdown in online store sales and inflationary pressure.

text: Amazon missed on both earnings and revenue estimates. The weak results have pushed AMZN shares lower by as much as 10% in aftermarket hours on elevated volume.

title: Amazon stock plunges to two-year low following first quarter loss
text: Amazon stock plunged to a two-year low as shares slid as much as 12% on Friday morning after the company reported its first-quarter results yesterday. The company reported a loss of $3.84 billion, or $7.56 a share, for the first quarter.

title: Amazon Shares (AMZN) Plunge On A Big Profit Miss And Soft Outlook

title: The Ratings Game: Amazon's price targets are slashed and stock sinks after first quarterly loss in seven years
text: Amazon.com Inc. shares sank more than 12% in Friday trading after the e-commerce and tech giant reported its first quarterly loss in seven years.

title: Big Tech Are Falling Titans
text: The competitive playing fields are evening out, and Big Tech is losing its edge. It's time to buy the tech startups that are unseating them.

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones, S&P 500 Down As Amazon Misses Earnings
text: Markets opened in red today on pressure from mixed tech earnings.

title: Amazon's stock suffering biggest selloff in more than 10 years, is wiping out $183 billion in market cap
text: Shares of Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, -12.24% tumbled 12.5% in morning trading Friday, enough to pace the S&P 500's SPX, -1.14% losers, after the ecommerce giant reported a surprise first-quarter loss and revenue that came up a bit shy. The stock, which was trading at the lowest levels seen during regular-session hours since June 2020, was on track for the biggest one-day percentage selloff since it plunged 12.7% on Oct. 26, 2011.

title: Dismal Forecast Sends Amazon Stock to 2-Year Lows
text: It's been a huge week for Big Tech earnings, and Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) finally joined in, though its first-quarter results were lacking to say the least.

title: Why Is Amazon (AMZN) Stock Down 10% Today?
text: AMZN stock is falling today after the e-commerce giant disappointed investors with its results and outlook for the second quarter. The post Why Is Amazon (AMZN) Stock Down 10% Today?

title: Why Amazon Shares Are Falling Today
text: Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) shares are trading lower Friday after the company reported first-quarter financial results and issued second-quarter guidance below analyst estimates.  Amazon said first-quarter revenue increased 7% year-over-year to $116.4 billion, which beat the $116.3 billion.

title: Victoria's Secret and Pink to sell on Amazon
text: Beauty products from Victoria's Secret & Co. VSCO, +6.00% , including the namesake brand and the Pink brand, began selling on the Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +4.65% site on Friday. Customers can shop the more than 120 items.

title: Futures fall as Amazon, Apple results disappoint
text: U.S. stock index futures fell on Friday as disappointing quarterly reports from Amazon and Apple pressured growth stocks, pushing the tech-heavy Nasdaq toward its worst month in two years.

title: Justice Dept. Joins DC's Antitrust Action Against Amazon
text: The Biden administration has asked a judge to review a suit accusing Amazon of anticompetitive behavior, Bloomberg writes, to possibly bring it back after it was dismissed. The suit, previously dismissed in March, alleged Amazon's contracts with merchants had inflated prices.

title: Victoria's Secret is taking its beauty business to Amazon in its first-ever wholesale test
text: Victoria's Secret is taking its beauty business to Amazon, marking the lingerie company's first major tie-up with another retailer to sell its goods.

title: 2 Monster Warren Buffett Stock-Split Stocks to Buy Right Now
text: These Buffett-backed stocks are poised to carry out stock splits in the near future.

title: Amazon and Apple updates may cause new wobble for tech sector, though analysts confident
text: Just a day after the US tech sector hit a 16-month low, trillion-dollar titans Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) did not fully reassure investors with their numbers from the past quarter. In fact, Amazon fell well short of expectations, with a first quarterly net loss since 2015, of US$3.8bn, as operating profits fell for the third quarter in a row, with online sales down 3% and shipping costs revved up 14%.

title: Amazon's net loss prompts query: Has it built too many warehouses?
text: In recent years, Amazon.com Inc has spent billions of dollars on new warehouses that cut into profits, explaining to investors that it had no choice but to meet ever-rising consumer demand.

title: Amazon Stock Sinks. But This Part of the Business Could Help Shares Fly Again.
text: After weak earnings and a disappointing outlook, the performance in Amazon's cloud computing business remains a bright spot.

title: Market Snapshot: Stock futures lower ahead of inflation data, with tech under pressure after Apple, Amazon disappointment
text: Stock futures were moving mostly lower on Friday, with tech stocks set to lead the way south after disappointing results from industry giants Amazon.com Inc. and Apple Inc.
